channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Goals by Millie Bright and Erin Cuthbert gave Chelsea a 2-0 win over Manchester City in the first Women's Community Shield ever to be played at Wembley Stadium on Saturday.
item.title: Chelsea beat Man City in women's Community Shield despite Kerr misses

item.description: The Italian coastguard sent help on Saturday to a rescue boat funded by British street artist Banksy after the vessel issued urgent calls for assistance, saying it was stranded in the Mediterranean and overloaded with migrants.
item.title: Italy sends help to Banksy's overloaded migrant rescue boat

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: It's not just 18th birthday cakes and speeches that our Year 12s are missing out on.
item.title: The Class of 2020: Coming of age under COVID-19's shadow

item.dc:creator: Michael Ruffles
item.description: Six years in Australia as a ‘student prince’ came at a crucial time for the man who would become the Thai monarch, and for the country he would rule.
item.title: The miseducation of King Rama X

item.description: You can get a permit to leave Australia to sit on your new yacht but you can’t go to your only daughter’s wedding overseas.
item.title: Rudderless pandemic travel rules all at sea

item.dc:creator: Danny Weidler
item.description: Paul McGregor is eager to be an NRL coach again but right now he has another priority: caring for his dad, who is battling an aggressive form of dementia.
item.title: ‘He's my hero’: McGregor opens up on caring for ailing dad after Dragons exit

item.dc:creator: Sarah Mitchell
item.description: The grit, determination and maturity with which students have faced this year will stand them in good stead to conquer whatever difficulties the future will throw at them.
item.title: 2020 may be a year you want to forget but it has also given you a gift

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The NRL had been spending almost $500,000 a day. Those costs are about to be dramatically slashed.
item.title: 'We’re not mucking around': NRL slashes costs by $80m a year

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: State of Origin is the pinnacle of rugby league, but players may make other choices in the new COVID world.
item.title: Fittler fears five-week bubble may force players out of Origin

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Some of his most formative years were on our watch.
item.title: It's the decent thing to do: Australia should take back the Christchurch killer

item.dc:creator: Michael Spence
item.description: Your ATAR is not going to follow you around for the rest of your life. It is a measure of how you performed academically over 18 months, but that is all.
item.title: ATAR doesn't measure all the wonderful things that make you who you are

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: "There will be a large number of people out there who feel they are the next Sherlock Holmes - maybe they can solve something we can't", says the officer in charge.
item.title: NSW Police have a new investigation technique: a podcast

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: rather than attacking the Queensland government, Byron's Mayor said the NSW government needs to step in.
item.title: 'We need help': Mayors beg state government for assistance over Queensland border closure

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: Sydney bar tsar, Justin Hemmes celebrated his 48th birthday with family, friends and naturally - his iconic seaplane alongside a bevvy of beauties.
item.title: Merivale playboy Justin Hemmes puts on a model 48th birthday bash

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Even in a city known for miserable winters, none have been quite like this. But hang in there. Spring begins on Tuesday and there's cause to be optimistic.
item.title: Time to put a Spring in our (socially distanced) step, Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The ABF is approving travel requests at a much higher rate and is making decisions within hours that previously took weeks.
item.title: 'Definite shift' in Border Force approach to travel ban as approvals surge

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Boys are twice as likely to be at or below national minimum standard (NMS) by age 15 than girls.
item.title: One in five year 9 boys below minimum writing standard: NAPLAN review

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: The Aged Care Minister was accused of abandoning his responsibilities after walking out of the Senate chamber this week.
item.title: Who is Richard Colbeck? The low-profile minister in the middle of a COVID crisis

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Applications for some admission schemes have tripled as year 12 students rush to shore up their future amid the uncertainty caused by COVID-19.
item.title: NSW universities make record number of early offers to Class of 2020

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The NSW government has taken the lead on an Australian-first service to notify multiple organisations when someone dies so accounts can be closed or transferred.
item.title: 'I am supremely organised but was not prepared': hurdles after a loved one dies

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: There have been few tastes of freedom for the Class of 2020 and far greater restrictions than any year 12 group has ever experienced.
item.title: We must smooth the path to adulthood for the Class of 2020

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Labor has called for an independent investigation into the Berejiklian government's decision to raise Rob Roger's salary to $450,000 amid a pay freeze for public servants.
item.title: Rural Fire Service Commissioner snares 11% pay rise

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: After a successful first week of the hybrid physical-virtual Parliament, some MPs want it to become a permanent fixture.
item.title: 'Valuable family infrastructure': MPs call for virtual Parliament to become permanent

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Aussies and Kiwis looking to take a holiday in each other's backyards shouldn't give up hope - the plan for a travel bubble could still take off.
item.title: Australia-New Zealand travel plan still bubbling away

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: Motorists will be forced to slow down in more areas of Sydney as speed limits are lowered to improve road safety.
item.title: Sydney slows down as state government pushes for lower speed limits

item.dc:creator: Michael Koziol
item.description: The hotel quarantine system for returned travellers is running below its stated capacity, with significantly fewer than 4000 Australians are actually arriving home from overseas each week.
item.title: Quarantine system for returned travellers running below capacity

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australian security agencies are on alert for extremists who could have been inspired by the Christchurch mosque killer and other massacres overseas, as small far-right cells across the country are becoming more organised and sophisticated than ever before.
item.title: 'More organised, sophisticated and security conscious than before': Right-wing extremist threat growing

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: A temporary harbour swimming area could be created while North Sydney Olympic Pool is closed for redevelopment.
item.title: Laps at Lavender Bay? Pop-up harbour pool could be an alternative for North Sydney swimmers

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: Kate Jenkins says a key lesson of the crisis must be the importance of childcare and the massive barrier to work posed by a lack of accessibility.
item.title: Childcare key to getting women back to work after pandemic: sex discrimination commissioner

item.dc:creator: Michael Koziol
item.description: The Sydney Symphony Orchestra has abandoned its annual production of Last Night of the Proms, currently the subject of a culture war in Britain.
item.title: Rule, Britannia! no more as SSO dumps Last Night of the Proms

item.dc:creator: Vivienne Pearson
item.description: Border closures out of step with in-state COVID-19 restrictions are hugely unfair for those who happen to live near a line on a map drawn over a century ago.
item.title: Harsh realities of border disorder demand new approaches

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: The embers are still smoking around the bridges Emma Alberici burned down on her way out of the ABC, while Melissa Doyle couldn't praise her bosses enough when her 25-year career at Seven ended.
item.title: Lawsuits and tweets: A tale of two very different TV exits

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Born as Sydney was announced as the Olympic host, Tom Decent channels his inner seven-year-old to recall a magical 16 days in September 2000.
item.title: The magic of the Sydney Olympics through the eyes of a child

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Elderly people are delaying entering aged care during the COVID-19 pandemic, contributing to low occupancy rates that could threaten the financial viability of aged care providers.
item.title: Elderly delay entry to nursing homes

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Flatmates Annabel Ellis and Lucy Foley, both 23, are hardly spending any money but for very different reasons.
item.title: Household savings climb as Aussies hunker down for recession

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: A vocational college was offered Crown land by a NSW regional council to build a training-and-research facility for international students without bidding in a tender.
item.title: NSW council accused of 'sham' tender over China-backed project

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: An arsonist burnt down our high school as we prepared for our HSC. Almost 40 years on, I hope there's a message in it for today's HSC candidates as they confront the hurdles of COVID-19.
item.title: Life's real trials are the only ones that matter

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Schools are preparing for the monumental task of individually assessing 50,000 VCE students for special consideration of disadvantage due to COVID-19.
item.title: 'Like a hurricane': Plea for fair go for students hit hardest by virus

item.dc:creator: Melanie Kembrey
item.description: Trent Dalton, Craig Silvey and Richard Flanagan will all release new novels on the same day in September.
item.title: Save the date: Three major Australian authors go head to head

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Life-saving organ donation has continued despite the odds and disruption wrought by COVID-19, Yvonne Wilson will say 'thank you' when she finds the right words.
item.title: Yvonne gained strength as the pandemic raged, and received a gift of life

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: The Demons were the beneficiary of a contentious goal by Christian Petracca in their three-point win over St Kilda but Simon Goodwin maintains the AFL needs to act to improve the use of technology.
item.title: Goal-line review: Demons coach Goodwin calls on AFL to act

item.dc:creator: Henrietta Cook
item.description: Phoenix Thoroughbreds, which co-owns Australian Group 1 winner Farnan who is trained by Gai Waterhouse, was banned from racing in France earlier this month after a prosecution witness alleged in a New York court that its Dubai-based owner Amer Abdulaziz Salman had stolen $161 million in the OneCoin cryptocurrency scheme.
item.title: Racing officials probe horse racing outfit over cryptocurrency scam

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Victoria's public transport will lose 114 million yearly trips post-pandemic, and city roads face worsening congestion as infection-wary commuters desert the network in favour of their cars.
item.title: Back to cars: Public transport expected to take post-pandemic beating

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: The victim impact statements for the sentencing of the Christchurch mass killer were the grace-filled antithesis of everything the Australian terrorist stood for.
item.title: I forgive you: Why victims' empathy was kryptonite to the Christchurch killer

item.dc:creator: Jon Faine
item.description: The window of convenience that saw a working relationship blossom during Covid-19 is coming to a tragic end.
item.title: The Andrews-Morrison bromance is heading for an ugly break-up

item.description: The risk to healthcare workers remains far too high. We need broader expertise to address it.
item.title: Our infection-control response is broken. We need a new model - and fast

item.description: Far from the familiar loop of comparing today with yesterday it is possible to imagine what tomorrow could be and work to make it so.
item.title: Faith column: This is a time for visionaries

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Periodic purges can help you avoid the distress of owning too much stuff, but how best to find the balance?
item.title: I've spent zero on clothes in 2020 (with help from Marie Kondo)

item.dc:creator: Michael Koziol
item.description: It's an ethical conundrum for our times: should you share details and photos of your social life or keep it secret and pretend to be miserable?
item.title: With Melbourne still in lockdown, should Sydneysiders censor their spring fun?

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: After giving up a 21-point lead, Melbourne, led by Steven May and Christian Petracca, fought back to win a thriller against St Kilda and re-enter the top eight.
item.title: As it happened: Melbourne Demons win a thriller against St Kilda Saints to boost finals hopes
